projects.description: This is a browser-based app that displays a random set of quotes on a timed loop. This project was a good way to practice using DOM manipulation, template literals, and dot notation. I made the quote automatically change every seven seconds using setInterval and I added a button and used an event listener to give the user the ability to change the quote at any moment.

For my second Treehouse project, I made a student directory that uses pagination so that the user can easily navigate between pages. I included a dynamic search feature that will filter the displayed student profiles on every key-press.

This form collects information from users who want to sign up for a fictional conference. I also used regular expressions for form validation. I used a variety of html form elements to create the form, including checkboxes, dropdown-menus and text input fields.

This project uses object-oriented programming to create a browser-based, word-guessing game. I used a constructor to initialize the hidden phrase and the other game properties. I made a Game class that includes many of the methods that are used throughout the gameplay.

The Employee Directory project introduced me to third-party APIs. I used the Random User Generator API to create a fictional employee directory. The directory also used asynchronous programming to allow the page to run smoothly while data is requested from the Random User Generator API.
